intro: Hieracium euthylepioides, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium euthylepioides is often found in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
